what: Creates a sankey visual extended from python's matplottlib
title: Creates a sankey visual extended from python's matplottlib
text: goal matplotlibSankey create sankey plot ’s wide format (one matplotlib).

title: Creates a sankey visual extended from python's matplottlib
text: can install development version matplotlibSankey GitHub :

title: Creates a sankey visual extended from python's matplottlib
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(matplotlibSankey) #> Loading required package: reticulate #> Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 4.1.3  ## install the python libraries: # install_matplotlib()  ## define data example example2 <- data.frame(   flows = c(15, 0, 60, -10, -20, -5, -15, -30, -20),   labels = c('', '', '', 'First', 'Second', 'Third', 'Looooooong Fourth',              'Fifth', 'Hurray!'),   orientations = c(-1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, -1, 1, 0),   pathlengths = c(0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.1, .5, 0.25,                   0.25),   color='r' )  ## create the sankey chart #sankey(x = example2, fig_title = "Boom?", sankey_color = "lightblue", sankey_label = "the whole system")

title: install python library matplotlib — install_matplotlib
text: method PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'auto' conda PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'auto'

title: create sankey visual — sankey
code: sankey(   x,   settings_scale = 0.01,   settings_offset = 0.2,   settings_head_angle = 90,   settings_format = "%.0f",   settings_unit = "%",   fig_title,   sankey_label = "",   sankey_color = FALSE,   center_text_bold = FALSE )

title: create sankey visual — sankey
text: x PARAM_DESCRIPTION settings_scale PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 0.01 settings_offset PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 0.2 settings_head_angle PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 90 settings_format PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: "%.0f" settings_unit PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: "%" fig_title PARAM_DESCRIPTION sankey_label PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: "" sankey_color PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: FALSE center_text_bold PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: FALSE

title: create sankey visual — sankey
code: if (FALSE) { if(interactive()){  #EXAMPLE1  example1 <- data.frame(  flows = c(0.25, 0.15, 0.60, -0.20, -0.15, -0.05, -0.50, -0.10),  labels = c("", "", "", "First", "Second", "Third", "Fourth", "Fifth"),  orientations = c(-1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0, -1),  pathlengths=10  )   example2 <- data.frame(  flows = c(15, 0, 60, -10, -20, -5, -15, -30, -20),  labels = c('', '', '', 'First', 'Second', 'Third', 'Looooooong Fourth',  'Fifth', 'Hurray!'),    orientations = c(-1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, -1, 1, 0),  pathlengths = c(0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.1, .5, 0.25,  0.25),  color='r'  )   sankey(x = example2, fig_title = "Boom?", sankey_color = "lightblue", sankey_label = "the whole system")   } }
